title: Great ending to a great trip
text: The atmosphere is wonderful and the outside seating beautiful. Courteous staff, great food and wine. It was the last dinner on a tour and this place I won't forget. Right by the Acropolis. Wear good walking shoes as it is up hill.

title: Cramped in coach
text: British Airlines is a good airline with good connections from PHL to LHR and Athens. The food on the plane was good as well as the wine served and offered at no cost. However, the seating in coach could have had a few more inches and depth to the seats. There was a 2 hour delay as the plane from LHR to PHL on return had a mechanical issue. I was also selected to have a special security check-so much fun.

title: Lots of walking
text: Beautiful scenery and shops. Good restaurants as well. Nice and friendly people along the way. Prices good as well.

title: Beautiful
text: A gorgeous and educational site. Walking could be difficult as there are paths but it is uphill. Some loose rocks along the way. Wear comfortable shoes.

title: Antiquities
text: Walking could be difficult for some folks as most of the site is walking uphill. Beautiful scenery and feels like a step back in time. Lots of antiquities to see.

title: Learning experience
text: Beautiful museum and knowledgeable staff. Easy to navigate throughout the museum. Beautiful grounds and nice restrooms.

title: Nice view
text:
Within walking distance of acropolis and museums. Walking distance to shops and antiquities. Beautiful view of acropolis from the roof top restaurant, especially at night. Elevator was a bit small for a large piece of luggage and two thin people at maximum. Staff was very accomodating. Breakfast buffet and seating area was nice.
There were two single beds in the room and as I had a room share on a tour we pushed the beds apart.

title: This hotel is conviently located on Main Street in Chincoteague. It is within walking distance of shops and restaurants
text: The staff is very courteous and gave a homelike welcome. The breakfast each morning was good as was the seating area. The room was comfy and acceptable. I was on the first floor and could hear the guests above me on the second floor. The pier and water area is beautiful. The staff did anything to be helpful.

title: Cats and Coffee
text: Very nice, clean cattery with three levels of cats. Wednesday is 1/2 off the admission price so I paid $12 to visit with the cats. There were 18 of them and all very healthy and mostly playful. The outside enclosure is very accomodating to them and they can come from the bottom level inside to the first level. Instructions are given before entering their enclosure as to hand sanitizing, removing shoes for slippers provided, and not to pick up any of the cats - but petting is OK as is playing. After or before cativity, you can get a bite to eat or have a coffee in a relaxed but small atmosphere. Reservations are suggested but I stopped by and was lucky on my timing to be able to see the place. Great experience for a cat luver.

title: Doesn't exist
text: I stopped by this address, researched online and when I arrived, it was an apartment building - that's it - no cafe, no cats, no people. What's up with that??

title: Great Food
text: Nice atmosphere in the MGM Grand casino/hotel. We went to the David Copperfield show after dinner which was in the casino theater. Very convienient to the show. Great food and great wait staff.

title: 2nd Time Around
text: About 30 years ago (and 30 years younger) I did this trip. The thrill doing this river trip is still the same as it was back then. The water was clear, the camps and beaches beautiful and the crew was incredible. They saw that each individual was taken care of any answered any questions we had. Everything was comfortable and the food was as if it was made in a gourmet kitchen. I highly recommed this trip for anyone wanting to push their adrenalin level to the highest. It's well worth the wait to go through Lava Falls the last day. The helicopter out for the 7 day isn't bad either.

title: Before the show
text: This Mexican restaurant is located beside The Sovereign Performing Arts Center in downtown Reading PA. Food was great as was service. Highly recommend it for dinner before a show.

title: "Reading did it right"
text: Great place to wander through art galleries, see local artisans create their craft and a quaint movie theater all in one location. Ample free parking.

title: Nice hotel
text: Large, safe hotel with beautiful amenities such as a large pool, dining area, lounge and lobby. Courteous staff, clean rooms, good food. Walking to town can be accomplished but maps a little confusing. Best taking a taxi from the hotel to town. Airport is at least an hour drive from hotel but plenty of vans and taxi service.
place: Radisson Hotel San Jose Costa Rica

title: Festive atmosphere
text: Large family oriented park. Safe feeling and lots of walking and vendors during the festival weekend.

title: Shop till you drop
text: Great shopping with loads of designer stores at great prices. Food court and restaurants in the area. Lots of free parking.

title: Nice Imax
text: The theater complex is in center city Reading. There is a free parking garage across the street from the theater for theater patrons and it is very well lite and safe. State of the art complex.

title: Reading event center
text: This venue is in center city Reading and across from a brand new hotel. Concerts and other shows bring in large crowds so good to plan ahead and grab some dinner at a local restaurant as parking can be a problem as the garage gets quite full with a big name artist.

title: Great Airline
text: Great customer service, friendly staff, no complaints. A great airline I would use again. Only wish southwest would fly out of Harrisburg or Allentown, PA.

title: Nice place in Franklin
text: The location is off interstate 65 on 31W. It is on top of a hill with nice views. One restaurant is within walking distance. Antique Mall across the street with other restaurants and plenty of gas stations. The Baymont has a great breakfast and nice rooms. There is also a pool and exercise room. Nice place for a short stay.

title: Archives in Franklin
text: Excellent and knowledgeable staff who can help find anything related to Franklin, KY. There are also tours of the jail in the same building.

title: Your average steakhouse
text: This is a very casual restaurant with a variety of menu items. The steak was good but nothing outstanding.

title: Great Antique Shopping
text: This place was very well managed, the antique dealers had their stands in great condition there being no clutter and everything was in place. Very clean and friendly staff and atmosphere.

title: Nice casino
text: Nice casino with nice large slot machines. There is also a restaurant/grill. Nice large, bright place with friendly staff.

title: The Cat's Meow
text: Great shop for cat lovers. The owner is very friendly and cat oriented. There are resident cats all wanting attention and are always there for petting. Lots of cat related items for purchase. Best cat house ever!!

title: Educational and Fun
text: Excellent self guided tour of the museum captures how things were on Titanic. Well worth seeing and great staff.

title: Dolly did it right!
text: Best theme park I've been to. Great friendly staff, great food, wonderful shows and museums. Keep up the great work, Dolly.

title: Beautiful Music
text: Great place to learn about gospel music. Nice exhibits that are educational. Staff available for questions. Very enjoyable.
place: Southern Gospel Music Hall of Fame and Museum

title: Airport convenience
text: Courteous staff throughout my stay, especially April who puts in long hours but loves her job. Room was excellent, shuttle service to airport on time. Nice location with restaurants within walking distance as well as small shopping area.

title: A Market Experience
text: Fairground's Farmers Market (now known as Boscov's Farmer's Market) is a wonder in itself with fresh meats and veggies, great places to eat and lots of baked goods. It is open Thursday thru Saturday and does get very crowded. If you like crowds and good food, this is the place to purchase as that good stuff.

title: Great fast food
text: Typical fast food restaurant with sit down or take out. One of the best fast food places around this area. Courteous and friendly staff.

title: Steam Bath
text: Nice small community theater with local actors and staff. Air conditioned and snacks/soda sold in lobby. Lighting could have been brighter in the theater itself.

title: Reading's Pagpda
text: Reading's landmark, the pagoda, is a beautiful place for out of town visitors wanting to experience Reading, PA. There is a great view from Skyline Drive and at night the Pagoda is lighted. There is a gift shop and various other shops inside. Hours vary.

title: Highly inspirational
text: The organ recital at noon was very beautiful and inspirational. The acoustics in the building are excellent. Stunning building.

title: Great place
text: Nice brew pub atmosphere, outside dining, great food and an upstairs for larger gatherings. Great staff.

title: Great Hotel
text: This hotel is situated within walking distance of Temple Square, the convention center, shopping areas and wonderful restaurants. The hotel staff was extremely helpful and there is a shuttle to airprt.

title: Best Friends Conference
text: The Salt Palace had spacious rooms for individual sessions as well as larger rooms for exhibits. Within walking distance of many hotels and restaurants.

title: Great Brews
text: This establishment is within walking distance of many hotels. The food is wonderful, a variety of local brews and a nice atmosphere and staff. Outside dining is available.

title: Yanni Rocks!!
text: The music theater is very easy to get to and is centrally located and driving from various areas is no problem. The parking lot is very good but does get crowded if arrival time is not at least an hour prior to a show. Parking is available at various stores and restaurants close to the venue. The acoustics are great, seating is great and the staff make you feel very welcome. Lots of outlets and restaurants nearby within walking distance. You may even see an Amish Buggy if you look close enough. The Yanni concert itself was over the top. You can tell I love that guy and even got to meet him at our fan gathering at Olive Garden.

title: Great Food
text: Escobars is a great place to eat as well as get together with coworkers and friends. The menu has a large variety of different foods and the portions are wonderful. A good deal for the money. Staff is very courteous and helpful. A busy place around dinner time.

title: Quick Stop
text: Great place to get sandwiches on the go or for packing a lunch for those great hikes in the Kanab area. A typical subway restaurant.

title: Bad Macs
text: This is a very old McDonalds and in definite need of upgrading. It was dirty and the service was very slow. The restroom had a smell and also could have used a good cleaning.

title: Good Food
text: This is a downtown restaurant well within walking distance to shops in Kanab. The service was a little slow but the food in general was very good. There are vegetarian dishes as well as the usual cuisine. Nothing fancy, a little down town cowboy but a nice place to eat.

title: Dog outing
text: Great place if you like to hike and walk on sand dunes. A gorgeous and quiet place if you know where to avoid crowds. You can see the dunes and hike over them by taking a left on 89 across from the back entrance to best friends. Drive about 5-9 miles and there is a pull off where you can park, get information about the dunes and have a nice hike. Take lots of water as after 11:30 a.m. it gets rather hot. If you go directly through the main entrance to the park, there is an admission fee.
place: Coral Pink Sand Dunes State Park

title: Fabulous!
text: I did this hike with Dreamland Safari out of Kanab. The drive to get there was about 2 hours from Kanab. We parked and walked about a mile through sand to get to the attraction itself. Lots of climbing rocks and walking but the formations are out of this world. Highly recommended. Permit required. A 4 wheel drive is needed as you will get stuck in the sand with a little rental car.

title: Good Food in Kanab
text: Great food, great staff and friendly atmosphere. A must place to eat if you are in Kanab. Families welcome.

title: I love Nedras Too
text: The atmosphere at Nedras Too has a flavor all it's own. The food is wonderful, especially the spinach enchilada - love that and get it every time I go there. Service is great and wait staff courteous. Good place to mix with the locals.

title: Volunteer at Best Friends
text: Best Friends is the place to be if you love gorgeous canyons, lots of animals, hiking trails and great food. Volunteers are their back bone and everyone who takes the time to visit and become a volunteer will leave with a song in their heart and a spring in their step. Take a dog or cat on an outing or a sleepover and you will have a wonderful time. The staff could not be any more courteous, happy and friendly. Tours are given several times daily at no charge and stops are made at various animal areas where tourists can get out and see and interact with cats or dogs. Go visit Best Friends and volunteer. It's a different world in Angel Canyon.

title: Flying Delta
text: Delta is top notch in the airline industry. All staff were courteous and helpful. No issues with this airline.

title: Days Inn St. George
text: This motel is very clean and has a homey atmosphere. There is an outdoor pool and a hot tub that looked well maintained but the weather was too cold in March. The room was very nice and a good size for 1 or 2 people. There was a fridge and a microwave in the room and the bathroom was nice as well. The continental breakfast could have offered a little more in respect to quality but overall was nice for those on the go. Staff was very accommodating and courteous. My only issue was the internet service as it did not seem to load and was very slow. Other than that, a nice place to stay if visiting all the sites in St. George. Restaurants were within walking distance.
place: Days Inn by Wyndham St. George

title: Rock climbing in St. George
text: Pioneer Park is a great place to see if you like hiking trails and climbing on huge rocks. There is a large rock where you can climb up and watch the sunset. Gorgeous views of the city. Within walking distance of Days Inn.

title: Temple at St. George
text: The visitors center at the Temple is very new and visitors are greeted immediately when they open the doors. Tour guides (sisters/brothers of the Mormon faith) explain their beliefs and show various exhibits of the inside Temple and what they do in each room. A video is available to watch that explains what the young people do on a mission and how they get involved in that work as well as what happens when the mission is done. A very good way to get an idea of the Mormon beliefs. The grounds are beautiful and easy to walk.

title: Great Food
text: The atmosphere of this restaurant was quaint and very comfortable. The staff, especially Jose, made our group feel at home and explained what we ordered on the menu as we did not speak Spanish. Our tour leader (G Adventures) wanted us to have a unique Peruvian experience by trying their delicacy Guinea Pig. The item was presented beautifully and we could not have asked for better presentation or service. The presentation of each plate was superb with what we ordered. The food was cooked perfectly, the drinks met our needs and overall the experience was perfect.

title: Cusco Travels
text: The streets were very clean and the scenery was gorgeous. I felt safe as there was a police presence in the area for safety. Children were very well behaved and people were friendly.

title: Ruins
text: Another site visited that was very clean, safe and friendly people. The walk around the site can be a little difficult for the older person but walking around the lower area can be done.

title: Cusco Travels
text: Another great and safe, clean plaza with shops along the perimeter. There were a lot of street dogs in the plaza and that seems to be the norm in this area. They are very friendly and do not bother the tourists.

title: Salt Pans
text: This is a spot not to be missed on any tour. Our tour leader explained how all the salt is used by all the residents. It is tended to daily and is impressive to see how the locals tend to this very important site.
